hanzi-su-wiki:
礁

Значения

Подводная скала, риф

Мнемоника

«Обжигающий» 焦 днище судна камень 石 — риф.
purpleculture_pinyin:
jiāo
reef; shoal rock
риф; мелководье
rtega_mnemonic:
礁礁RSreef, jetty, submerged rocks
  • stone 石 where birds 焦 may sit
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 焦 indicates the sound; 石 (rock) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
礁石 [ jiāo shí ]: reef
珊瑚礁 [ shān hú jiāo ]: coral reef
暗礁 [ àn jiāo ]: submerged reef (rock)
触礁 [ chù jiāo ]: (of a ship) to strike a reef; (fig.) to hit a snag
礁溪 [ jiāo xī ]: Jiaoxi or Chiaohsi township in Yilan county 宜兰县 , Taiwan
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 石 [ shí ] stone, rock, mineral
    • 焦 [ jiāo ] burned, scorched; anxious, vexed
heisig_chinese_memo: Reef (coral / rock formations) under the water near the beach makes surfers apprehensive because they don't want to wipe out and land on it. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: reef, stone, rock, char, turkey, oven-fire, barbecue
koohiiStory1: Coral reefs are now dying off due to our abuse of the environment and now look like charred stone. For a picture illustrating this, see http://www.nacri.org/images/Hof-dredgingfig8.jpg.
koohiiStory2: Reefs are often formed from volcanic rock, or "rock that has been charred".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The stone that looks like a turkey boiling underwater is just a reef.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: It may seem like there are a bunch of turkeys under there, but it's just the shape the reef takes. Though I guess if you're looking from above the water it really does look like a bunch of turkeys freaking out.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The reef is the Shougun's (しょう) favorite place to be nowadays. He sits next to the water, and stares down into it for hours.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You don't know if the Shougun likes the reef because he likes the beauty of the ocean, or if he's fantasizing about turkeys boiling. He's a... complex man.
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 杰, 石 (камень), 隹 (старая птица)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the stone (石) you're impatient (焦) to get away from is a reef
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Reef (coral / rock formations) under the water near the beach makes surfers apprehensive because they don't want to wipe out and land on it. &nbsp &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " stone " to the " jiao " sound. The original meaning is the rock that is close to the water surface in the rivers and oceans. Such as "Ming History. "He Qu Zhi IV": "If Tianjin is to Liao, there will be no ocean; Huai'an and Jiaozhou are only three hundred miles away, but the distance from Jiao to Deng is thousands of miles away, and the reef is difficult to move." Xu Ke, "Qing Barnyard Banknotes." Animals. "Rongluo": "(Rongluo) inhabits the shadow of a rocky reef, and its meat is quite delicious.

" Reef " is also the name of an ore. Song Yingxing of the Ming Dynasty "Heavenly Creations. Hardware. "Silver": "Where there are silver seedlings in the soil, there may be yellow gravel, or there are chaotic silk shapes in the crevices of the soil, and the mine is not far away. Those who become silver are called reefs, and those who are broken are called sand. Those who are like branches are called mines, and the surrounding stones are called mines."

" Reef " also means coal char. Fang Yizhi in the Ming Dynasty" Physics. Jinshi class. Coal and Graphite": "Coal is produced everywhere, and the smelly ones burn the iron and turn it into stone, and then chisel it into the furnace called the reef, but the fire will continue for five days. The frying (mining) of the stone is especially labor-saving."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " stone " to the " scorching " sound. The original meaning is the rock that is close to the water surface in the rivers and oceans.
humanum_full_description:
從「石」，「焦」聲。本義是江河海洋裡與水面距離很近的岩石。如《明史．河渠志四》：「若天津至遼，則大洋無泊；淮安至膠州，雖僅三百里，而由膠至登千里而遙，礁礙難行。」徐珂《清稗類鈔．動物類．榮螺》：「（榮螺）棲息巖礁之陰，肉味頗美。」

　　「礁」也是礦石名。明代宋應星《天工開物．五金．銀》：「凡土內銀苗，或有黃色碎石，或土隙石縫有亂絲形狀，此即去礦不遠矣。凡成銀者曰礁，至碎者曰砂，其面分丫若枝形者曰鑛，其外包環石塊曰礦。」

　　「礁」還表示煤焦。明代方以智《物理小識．金石類．煤炭石墨》：「煤則各處產之，臭者燒鎔而閉之成石，再鑿而入爐曰礁，可五日不絕火，煎丱（礦）煮石，殊為省力。」
humanum_short_description: 從「石」，「焦」聲。本義是江河海洋裡與水面距離很近的岩石。

礁字的基本解释

礁
jiāo
在海里或江里的岩石或珊瑚虫遗骸堆积成的岩状物：礁石。暗礁。珊瑚礁。触礁。

礁字的起名意思

：值江海中隐现于水面上下的岩石。

reef
Basic explanation of words
reef
jiāo
Rocks accumulated in the sea or river or the remains of coral polyps: reefs. Reef. Coral reef. Hit the rocks.

reef

reef
Name meaning
: Rocks looming above and below the water in the rivers and seas.
jiāo
риф, подводный камень
轮船触了礁了 пароход наскочил на риф
Radicals: 石, 隹, 灬  (stone, turkey, boil)
Meaning Mnemonic
The stone that looks like a turkey boiling underwater is just a reef.
It may seem like there are a bunch of turkeys under there, but it's just the shape the reef takes. Though I guess if you're looking from above the water it really does look like a bunch of turkeys freaking out.
Reading Mnemonic
The reef is the Shougun's (しょう) favorite place to be nowadays. He sits next to the water, and stares down into it for hours.
You don't know if the Shougun likes the reef because he likes the beauty of the ocean, or if he's fantasizing about turkeys boiling. He's a... complex man.
